subject: Re: [junit] Re: Exception Handling Question
msgSnippet: ... I think it s just a gut level fear and accompanying distaste of declaring methods with throws Exception (or including everything in the throws clauses of
messageBody:
>I agree with your model for this type of test case.. but why catch
>unexpected exceptions? Seems much cleaner to just let them propagate
>and let JUnit take care of reporting the failure.

I think it's just a gut level fear and accompanying distaste of
declaring methods with "throws Exception" (or including everything in
the throws clauses of every method called by a method). It's heinous in
real code, but might be OK in Test implementations. I'll have to
consider changing.

Regards,

Rob
